definitions.definition: the direction that is on your right when you watch the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass

examples.text: warmer weather coming from the south
He lives to the south of *(= further south than)* the city.
views of distant mountains to north and south

definitions.definition: the southern part of a country, a region or the world

examples.text: birds flying to the south for the winter
Houses are less expensive in the North than in the South *(= of the country)*.
They bought a villa in the South of France.

definitions.definition: the southern states of the US

examples.text: The South used to rely heavily on agriculture.

definitions.definition: the poorer countries in the southern half of the world

examples.text: The South comprises many diverse countries.
the vast informal economies of the Global South

wordOrigin: Old English sūth, of Germanic origin; related to Low German sud.
